Generation IV.Diamond: It lived in jungles around 100 million years ago. Its skull is as hard as iron.
Generation IV.Pearl: It was resurrected from an iron ball-like fossil. It downs prey with its head butts.
Generation IV.Platinum: A lifelong jungle dweller from 100 million years ago, it would snap obstructing trees with head butts.
Generation IV.HeartGold: Cranidos toughen up their already rock-hard heads by headbutting one another.
Generation IV.SoulSilver: Cranidos toughen up their already rock-hard heads by headbutting one another.

Generation V.Black: A lifelong jungle dweller from 100 million years ago, it would snap obstructing trees with head butts.

Generation VI.X: It was resurrected from an iron ball-like fossil. It downs prey with its headbutts.
Generation VI.Y: A lifelong jungle dweller from 100 million years ago, it would snap obstructing trees with headbutts.
Generation VI.Omega Ruby: It was resurrected from an iron ball-like fossil. It downs prey with its headbutts.
Generation VI.Alpha Sapphire: A lifelong jungle dweller from 100 million years ago, it would snap obstructing trees with headbutts.

Generation VII.Sun: It lived in jungles around a hundred million years ago. It used its skillful headbutts to combat Aerodactyl.
Generation VII.Moon: In rock layers where Cranidos fossils are found, the fossilized trunks of trees snapped in two are also often found.
Generation VII.Ultra Sun: A primeval Pokémon, it possesses a hard and sturdy skull, lacking any intelligence within.
Generation VII.Ultra Moon: Its hard skull is its distinguishing feature. It snapped trees by headbutting them, and then it fed on their ripe berries.

Generation VIII.Brilliant Diamond: It lived in jungles around 100 million years ago. Its skull is as hard as iron.
Generation VIII.Shining Pearl: It was resurrected from an iron-ball-like fossil. It downs prey with its headbutts.
Generation VIII.Legends: Arceus: An incredibly rare sight. They duel each other by ramming their heads together, and the resulting sound echoes throughout the area like the pealing of a bell.

Generation IX.Scarlet: It lived in jungles around a hundred million years ago. It used its skillful headbutts to combat Aerodactyl.
Generation IX.Violet: Cranidos toughen up their already sturdy heads by headbutting one another.
